1.verse: Greeting - Paul, a prisoner of Christ Jesus, and Timothy our brother, to Philemon, our dear friend and fellow worker,

2.verse: and to Apphia our sister, and to Archippus our fellow soldier, and to the church in your house.

3.verse: Grace to you and peace from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.

4.verse: Thanksgiving and Prayer for Philemon - I thank my God, always making mention of you in my prayers,

5.verse: because I hear about your love and faith which you have toward the Lord Jesus and for all the saints.

6.verse: I pray that the fellowship of your faith may become effective in the knowledge of every good thing that is in us for Christ.

7.verse: For I have great joy and encouragement from your love, because the hearts of the saints have been refreshed through you, brother.

8.verse: Paul’s Appeal for Onesimus - Therefore, although I have great confidence in Christ to order you to do what is proper,

9.verse: instead I appeal to you because of love, since I am such a one as Paul, now an old man and also a prisoner of Christ Jesus.

10.verse: I am appealing to you concerning my child whom I became the father of during my imprisonment, Onesimus.

11.verse: Once he was useless to you, but now he is useful to you and to me,

12.verse: whom I have sent back to you himself, that is, my heart,

13.verse: whom I wanted to keep with me, in order that he might serve me on behalf of you during my imprisonment for the gospel.

14.verse: But apart from your consent, I wanted to do nothing, in order that your good deed might be not as according to necessity, but according to your own free will.

15.verse: For perhaps because of this, he was separated from you for a time, in order that you might have him back forever,

16.verse: no longer as a slave, but more than a slave, a beloved brother, especially to me, but how much more to you, both in the flesh and in the Lord.

17.verse: Paul’s Request to Philemon - If therefore you consider me a partner, receive him as you would me.

18.verse: But if in anything he has caused you loss or owes you anything, charge this to my account.

19.verse: I, Paul, write this with my own hand: I will pay it back, lest I mention to you that you owe me even your very self besides.

20.verse: Yes, brother, I ought to have some benefit of you in the Lord; refresh my heart in Christ.

21.verse: Confident of your obedience, I am writing to you because I know that you will do even beyond what I say.

22.verse: At the same time also, prepare a guest room for me, for I hope that through your prayers I will be restored to you.

23.verse: Final Greetings and Benediction - Epaphras, my fellow prisoner in Christ Jesus, greets you,

24.verse: and so do Mark, Aristarchus, Demas, and Luke, my fellow workers.

25.verse: The grace of the Lord Jesus Christ be with your spirit.
